intro: Ellisochloa rangei, commonly known as the Range grass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, wind-pollinated flowers. Ellisochloa rangei is adapted to well-drained soils and can thrive in areas with moderate to high rainfall. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
